intro: Hormidium caetense, commonly known as the desert flax, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments through its deep root system and reduced leaf surface. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Hormidium caetense plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for desert wildlife.
